it is best to install the gstreamer libs..and then also w32codecs, it is not too hard at all.
as for MPlayer, you dont really need it, I find, but, I have instructions on how to install it.
there is a file on your comptuer at /etc/apt/sources.list
This file has all the URLs from which it apt-get installs.
change this file, so that you can have all the URLs from which to download various programs.
once you change your sources.list file properly, you haev to sudo apt-get update in a terminal, so the new sources are loaded...
yeah, your System, Administration menu has a program ccalled synaptic, which is a tool for searching your sources, and installing, and removing programs..
now that you have the sources added.
save teh file, close it. open a terminal, and type in sudo apt-get update
if it comes back with an error, well tweakl your sources list
ill show you how to search them, in case you dont know,
let us know when you are listening to an mp3...
for wmv and other movie support you can sudo apt-get install w32codecs now
